alerts.name: High Exception Rate
alerts.description: Monitors if the exception rate in the CrashController exceeds the threshold, indicating possible application errors.
alerts.query: SELECT count(*) FROM Transaction WHERE appName = 'PetClinic' AND error IS NOT NULL
alerts.rationale: Frequent exceptions indicate potential system instability and require immediate attention to prevent user disruption.

alerts.name: Database Connection Failure
alerts.description: Tracks the failure rate of database connections to detect possible connectivity issues.
alerts.query: SELECT count(*) FROM Database WHERE appName = 'PetClinic' AND status = 'FAILURE'
alerts.rationale: A high number of database connection failures can lead to significant application downtime and should be resolved immediately.

alerts.name: Owner Update Errors
alerts.description: Monitors the rate of errors when updating owner information to identify potential data validation issues.
alerts.query: SELECT count(*) FROM Transaction WHERE appName = 'PetClinic' AND name = 'processUpdateOwnerForm' AND error IS NOT NULL
alerts.rationale: Tracking these errors can help identify issues in data validation or incorrect input handling, improving application reliability.
